greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A007947(A122111(n)).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
Index entries for sequences computed from indices in prime factorization
mathematica: Block[{f}, f[1] = 1; f[n_] := Module[{l = #, m = 0}, Times @@ Power @@@ Table[l -= m; l = DeleteCases[l, 0]; {Prime@ Length@ l, m = Min@ l}, Length@ Union@ l]] &@ Catenate[ConstantArray[PrimePi[#1], #2] & @@@ FactorInteger@ n]; Array[If[# < 1, 0, Sum[EulerPhi[d] Abs@ MoebiusMu[d], {d, Divisors[#]}]] &@ f[#] &, 105]] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Nov 18 2019, after _JungHwan Min_ at A122111. *)
program: A064989(n) = {my(f); f = factor(n); if((n>1 && f[1,1]==2), f[1,2] = 0); for (i=1, #f~, f[i,1] = precprime(f[i,1]-1)); factorback(f)};
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Nov 17 2019
